text:
Clyde is a city in Cloud County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 716 people lived there.
History.
Clyde was planned out in 1867 that makes it the oldest town in Cloud County. It was named after the River Clyde, in Scotland. According to another source, it was named for Clyde, Ohio (which also is named indirectly for the River Clyde.)
Clyde experienced growth in 1877 when the Central Branch Railroad was built through it.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 716 people, 297 households, and 194 families living in the city.
Education.
The Clifton-Clyde High School mascot is Eagles. Before to school unification in 1981, the Clyde High School mascot was Bluejays.
The Clifton Cardinals won the state 1A football championship in 1969
The Clyde Bluejays won the Kansas State High School 1A Football championship in 1977 and the boys 1A Basketball championship in 1979.
